message.content: {"id": "41039", "title": "Hitting the Enter key in the Find/Replace dialog does not perform a Find operation on Mac OS X", "description": "When using Eclipse 3.0 M2 (Build id: 200307181617) on Mac OS X 10.2.6, if you open the Find/Replace dialog (Edit -> Find/Replace) and type in a search term into the text box, hitting the Return key does not do anything. We expect that hitting the Return key should perform a Find operation, just like clicking on the Find button (which is highlighted as the default button in the Find/Replace dialog).", "OB": "Hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog does not perform a Find operation on Mac OS X.", "EB": "Hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog should perform a Find operation on Mac OS X.", "SR": "The Find/Replace dialog on Mac OS X should respond to the Enter/Return key and perform a Find operation when a search term is entered."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '41039', 'title': "Bug 41039Hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog doesn't do anything on Mac OS X", 'description': "Bug 41039Hitting the Enter/Return key in the Find/Replace dialog doesn't do anything on Mac OS X ", 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'Eclipse 3.0 M2Build id: 200307181617Mac OS X 10.2.61) Open the Find/Replace dialog (EditFind/Replace).2) Type in a search term into the text box.3) Hit the return key.Nothing happens.Hitting the Return key should do a "Find" operation (thesame as clicking on the "Find" button, which is highlighted as the "default"button in the Find/Replace dialog). '}
